Speaker: lewis
Dialogue: Shit.  Maintenance never gets down here.

Dialogue: So what am I supposed to do?  Can't transfer him to Leavenworth.  He's civilian.  So I put him in an isolation cell that hasn't been used since the Spanish Inquisition.

Dialogue: Maybe you should have tried cutting him some slack.

Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: singleterry
Dialogue: Tranquilizer syrette gun.  Borrowed it from the Animal Control Department.

Dialogue: Gimme a break.  Open it.

Speaker: lewis

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: At ease, Rambo.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Wait outside.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Hello, John.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Colonel.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Mind if I sit down?

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: I hear you're not enjoying it here.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: I could take it or leave it.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Seems like I'm always pulling you out of some goddamn toilet or other, doesn't it?

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Am I out of here?

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: That depends on you.  Christ, look at you.  I give you this easy duty until I can get you an assignment... all you have to do is eat ice cream and watch soap operas... and you have to make it Rambo's last stand.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: There were treating me like a headcase.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Hard to believe.  You shoot up one little town in Oregon with a fifty caliber machine gun... one little dogpatch town... and everybody figures your wrapper's broken.  No sense of humor.  What did you expect?  An engraved plague from the chamber of commerce?

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: In 'Nam I flew gunships.  Million dollar equipment.  Back here nobody trusts me to park cars.  I keep thinking it's going to be okay... but I've been out six years and it's not okay.  Sometimes I feel like I'm coming right out of my skin.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: This your stuff?

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: That's it.  My life.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Hardcore outfit.  The best I ever trained.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Those men are all dead.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: You're not.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Congressional Medal of Honor.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Yeah.  Big time.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Plus, what else?  Two Silver Stars, four Bronze Stars, two Soldier's Medals, four Vietnamese Crosses of Gallantry and... uh, a handful of Purple Hearts.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Five.  I never wanted that stuff.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: What did you want?

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: After all that.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: You just picked that wrong war to be a hero in.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Let's take a walk.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Jason Kirkhill... John Rambo.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Good to meet you, Rambo.  How are you?

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: You a spook?

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: That's right.  CIA Special Operations Division.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: I don't work with spooks.  Not after that op in Cambodia.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: I'm authorized to get you out of here.  I thought that's what you wanted.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: What's the job?

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Classic special forces op... hit fast... in and out.  Two men.  Two days.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Why me?

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: At least the computer at Langley likes you.  Pulled your file because of various factors.  Service record. Area familiarity.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Not yet.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: I'm not jumping blind.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: It's yes or no.  In or out... now. If it's "out," we will not have had this conversation.  If you come in, you will not be working for us.  No knowledge.  No comment.  Do you understand?

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Tell him.  I'll take responsibility.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: North Vietnam.  What they call the Democratic Republic of Vietnam now.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: We left some people behind there, John... POWs.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: This just occurred to somebody, now?

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: We don't leave our men, Rambo.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: You got it.  I'm in.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: This is your mission packet...

Speaker: aide
Dialogue: Sign here, please.  And here.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Memorize it here.  It doesn't leave this room.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: The twenty-four hundred American servicemen missing in action in Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia are officially listed "Presumed Killed." Certainly most of them are.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: But reports keep filtering in. Sightings by refugees.  Nothing verified.  Finally, we feel we've got enough to proceed on.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Memo E-7 on top will cover the details.  An abandoned Vietnamese Army base in the North-central highlands may have a compound used as an internment camp.  As you can see the intelligence is soft.  These LANDSAT photos show huts... barracks.  It could be anything.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: What's the plan?

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: This operation is in two phases. Recon and rescue.  You are phase one.  Your two-man team will probe the site, confirm the presence of American POWs, if any, make photographic and tactical observations, then proceed to the extraction point without engaging the enemy.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: We don't try to pull out any of our guys if we find them?

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Negative.  Absolutely not.  The phase two assault team will get them out.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: We just take pictures?

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Don't look so disappointed.  It should be hairy enough... even for you.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Sorry old buddy, I saw it first.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: I kinda got an important date.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: No problem.  We'll share it.  Get your tail in there, sweet thing.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Indra Hotel.  And don't take the scenic route, Smiley... I know my way around this burg.  Comprende?

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Same place for me.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Ah, you fair flower of the Orient.

Dialogue: She thinks everything I say is funny.  Don't you, Angel-pie?  Man, Thai women are the best.  Got the kinda legs I like... feet at one end and pussy at the other.

Dialogue: Sometimes.

Dialogue: Sweet thing, there's nothin' I'd like more than to wugga-wugga with you for a week, but tonight's all we got.

Dialogue: Listen up.  You two are married as of now.  Get used to it.

Dialogue: Nice work.

Dialogue: Two.  'Eye-corps' mostly.

Dialogue: How about you?

Dialogue: Vietnam was a little before my time. So was Korea, know what I mean?

Dialogue: Black.  No sugar.

Dialogue: The League of Families leans on Congress.  Then they lean on us. Like we don't have enough to worry about in a dozen dirtwater countries.  Damnit!

Dialogue: Yeah.  Second set.  Let's go.

Dialogue: Transponder-satellite relay. TRANSAT.

Dialogue: The signal's coded into infrared pulses, picked up by the spy satellite, bounced to the ground station in Okinawa and relayed to the hut...

Dialogue: No radio source.  Nothing for the bad guys to triangulate on.

Dialogue: Alright.  Alright.

Dialogue: That's it?  Some C-4, a map and a knife?

Dialogue: Exactly.

Dialogue: Just a thought.

Dialogue: You wanna know why I stood up for this show?

Dialogue: No.

Dialogue: I was in the brig.  They gave me a deal.  I blew up this Colonel's golf cart with an M-19.  He wasn't in it or anything... it was the symbolic value.  Seemed like a good idea at the time.

Dialogue: This place is a trip.

Dialogue: Buddhist monastery.  Fifteenth century.

Dialogue: Damn!  Leeches.

Dialogue: Get used to 'em.

Dialogue: You fucking crazy?  I need it to burn these things off.

As far as I'm concerned you're just along to back me up.  And I heard about you... about how twitchy you really are. Kill any civilians lately?

Dialogue: Listen real careful, freshmeat.  I don't know why they sent you.  Maybe they didn't want to waste a good man.  But you screw up once more and I'll kill you myself.

Dialogue: Man, are you strict.

Dialogue: Let's get that tent down!

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: I gotta tell you, it's just luck you guys came when you did.  They move us around a lot... We only been at that camp a week.  Got a smoke?

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: What kind of raggedy-ass rescue you call this?

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Why were you in the box?

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: Well, I caught this cobra, see...

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: You mean the snake?

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: Yeah.  It's not hard once you get the hang of it.  In the wrist. Anyway, I did what I always do when I get one...

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: Man they got pissed.  They beat the crap out of me, but... it's kind of a tradition.  You oughta see 'em run around.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: You got a bad attitude.

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: I know it.

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: Thanks lady.  You're pretty cute... doing anything this weekend?

Speaker: co
Dialogue: Eat slowly.  Don't make yourself sick.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Twenty-five minutes.  We'd better roll.

Speaker: kinh
Dialogue: Wa-ky number ten.  Do-ma.

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: Yeah, fuck your mama-san, too.  In the...

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: You slope bitch!

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: Wow!

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: What just happened?

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Are you okay?

Speaker: co
Dialogue: Yes.  But I lose many merits in next life.  Very bad.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Why'd they want us?

Speaker: co
Dialogue: They heard about escaped prisoner on radio.  Make deal.  More than we pay.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: They sold us out?  Now I'm pissed.

Speaker: co
Dialogue: They were fools.  To think there would be reward.  And to ask my help.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: co
Dialogue: Rambo.  NVA coming.  Pig dog Kinh say meet them here.  Whole garrison from Con Cuong is out.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Let's go.

Speaker: lifer
Dialogue: Back in Indian country.  Just like old times.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Let's ditch this Transat.  We don't need it.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Bury it here.  Work fast.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: You better take off.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Ain't you coming with us, sweet thing?

Speaker: co
Dialogue: My orders stay here.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: See you in California.

Speaker: co
Dialogue: Land of big PX.  Maybe I take you for a ride in my Cadillac.

Speaker: fuhrman
Dialogue: Three minutes.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Zen Hammer this is Slam Dunk One, do you copy?  Over.

Speaker: fuhrman
Dialogue: Roger, Slam Dunk One... what is your position?

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Let's move.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Go for it, man.  Good therapy.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: You guys comin' or what?

Speaker: fuhrman
Dialogue: Roger... we have you on visual.  We are coming in.  How many are you?

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Relay to command.  They have one of ours.

Speaker: telecom tech
Dialogue: Mr.  Kirkhill... I have an AWACS relay.  Zen Hammer reports the ground team has an American POW with them.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: What did you say?

Speaker: telecom tech
Dialogue: They've got one of ours.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: This station is now on Condition Bravo.  Harrison.  Meyers.  Goodell. Out... now!

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Go to your COMINT priority frequency.  Give me the mike... Zen Hammer, this is Coach One.  This is an Alpha-Kilo-Victor command priority.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: I want you to abort the operation immediately.

Speaker: fuhrman
Dialogue: Say again, Coach One?

Speaker: fuhrman
Dialogue: He wants us to abort before pick-up.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Confirm it.

Speaker: fuhrman
Dialogue: It is confirmed.  Yes, sir.

Speaker: doyle
Dialogue: Turnin' around.

Speaker: fuhrman
Dialogue: I thought you liked those guys.

Speaker: doyle
Dialogue: I do.  But they ain't payin' the rent, Jack.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Stay on your heading, Captain.

Speaker: doyle
Dialogue: Sorry, Sir.  Can't do it.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: That's an order.

Speaker: doyle
Dialogue: Sorry, Sir.

Speaker: lifer
Dialogue: We ain't Uncle Sam's misguided children no more, Colonel.  We're independent contractors.

Speaker: fuhrman
Dialogue: That's right, Sir.  We don't like this, but we are working for Mr. Kirkhill.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: You pathetic scum.

Speaker: doyle
Dialogue: Well, if there weren't POWs before, there are now.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Where's he going?  Do you read, Zen Hammer?  Over.  Son of a bitch!  They're ditching us!

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: The fuckers left us, man... they left us.

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: Oh... God.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Have a drink.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: You got five hours?  I'll tell you about Secretaries of State, and funding committees and diplomatic relations...

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Take your time.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Look, Colonel... we're all adults here.  This is a war.  A very quiet, very intense war.  People get sacrificed.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Not my people.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: But you're right... some people do get sacrificed.  Now tell me why you pulled the plug.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: You think I'm some whacko?  I like to hurt people?  I'm doing a job here.  If I knew what's right or wrong I'd be a goddamned priest, right?  So I follow directives... I do what I'm told.  It's simple.  If your boy had done what he was told, there wouldn't be a problem.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Don't dance me, Kirkhill.  You'll be walking funny.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Look, it was a screw-up, alright? They weren't supposed to find anything.  We thought that camp was empty.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: This mission was a scam from the word go?

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Word came down... they wanted an answer.  And they knew the answer they wanted: no POWs.  But it had to look good.  Best effort.  The whole dog-and-pony show.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Rambo and Brewer were selected as write-offs.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: It was clean.  Very clean... Rambo was a decorated Vietnam vet, a former POW himself... if he came out and said "No POWs" the sub-committee would buy it.  He gets himself caught he's a private citizen, a whacko, acting on his own.  If he gets proof, it gets lost somewhere between here and D.C.  Airtight. But no... Rambo's gotta be a hero. Thinks he's starring in his own war movie or something.  He put me in a corner.  No choice.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: "Terminate with extreme prejudice."

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: That's a crock.  We don't say that. Do you have any idea the shitstorm if he'd gotten back with that guy? If it went public?  The White House would have to act through channels. We're talking ransom.  Four billion bucks in war reparations to Vietnam to get the others back.  That's billion, Colonel.  With a "B".  For a few guys that've had their brains in a blender for ten years?  A pain in the ass to everybody?  No way. There's no way.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: So there never was a Phase Two rescue team?

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Of course not.  You can't get approval to rescue a kitten from a tree after Tehran.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: I understand.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Here.  Drink.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Expedience!

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: You're out of your depth, Trautman. Way out.  I'm acting correctly here. Not you.  Not your gung-ho jungle ace.  It's over.  Walk away.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: It's not over.  You made one mistake.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: What that?

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Rambo.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Are they going to torture us?

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: What... whattaya do?

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Hope they kill you by mistake.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: No talk!

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: This ain't happening.

Speaker: jensen
Dialogue: We were pulling for you, Dave.  We hoped you'd make it.

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: Next time.

Speaker: jensen
Dialogue: It's those Russian interrogators again.

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: Put him in the chair.

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: Thank you, Captain Vinh.  Leave one guard, please.

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: These people are so... vulgar in their approach.  I am Lieutenant Commander Podovsk.  I do not know who you are.  Will you tell me?

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: This is a poor beginning for an intimate relationship.  By tomorrow or the next day you will tell me things you would not tell a lover.

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: I see you are no stranger to pain. Then of course you must know how senseless it is to resist in the long run.  Is it possible you have been among my Vietnamese comrades before?

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: Yes.  I think that must be it. Where were you held?  Hanoi?  Son Tay?  I apologize.  I'm getting ahead.  Sometimes I get too eager. My comrade and I, in our capacity as advisors, have been sent from our center at Cam Ranh Bay to discover from you certain things... for example: whether you are working directly for the American government... Who your contacts were... and on and on.  Quite a list.  Will you tell me these things now?

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: Of course you won't.  But, as a moral man, I felt compelled to ask.

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: This is Lieutenant Palyushin.  To him you are a piece of meat.  Proceed.

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: I was sent here because of my command of your language.  It will be frustrating if we cannot have a nice chat.  Very frustrating.  Ready?

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: Test please.

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: Oh, yes.  Here is something you might be interested in.

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: A transcript of the conversation between your helicopter pilot and his commander, intercepted and unscrambled by our overworked cryptography staff.  Mmm.  "Zen Hammer... Slam Dunk." Colorful names.  Here we are: "Ah, Coach One... we have them in sight." And the reply: "Abort immediately. Return to base camp."

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: It seems they intentionally abandoned you on direct orders. There are the people you protect with your silence?  With your pain?

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: But you must scream.  You must. There is no shame.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Bastards!

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: Nyet!  Nyet!

Speaker: co
Dialogue: We get out.  Split up.  They not want me.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: You are amazing.

Speaker: co
Dialogue: Di di mau!  Go!  Go!

Speaker: palyushin
Dialogue: Find!  Now!

Speaker: tay
Dialogue: Where's Trang?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Vuoc?  You alright?

Speaker: tay
Dialogue: Bui?  Phong?  Than?

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Bob, hi.  Did you get my telex?  Thanks, buddy.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Get me a "Loach," I'm going back out to Ban Bung Kla.

Speaker: corporal
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: Hey, Brewer.  You okay?

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: I could use a beer.

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: Your buddy made it out last night. The place went apeshit.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Really?  How come he didn't take me?

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: Maybe because you're shot in the leg.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Oh, yeah.  Listen, how long do they keep you in this disease hole?

Speaker: jensen
Dialogue: Who knows?  I was in there for a month once.  De Fravio did three months.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: How do you keep from coming unglued?

Speaker: jensen
Dialogue: Concentrate on a problem.  Like, I built my dream house in my head, brick by brick.  Board by board.  If something really takes a day, I thought about it for a whole day. Like that.

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: I built a shopping mall.

Speaker: jensen
Dialogue: Guards.  See ya.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: I'm dinky dau!

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: I think you know where he is going. Is there a rendezvous point?  Some guerrilla contract?  A transmitter perhaps.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: No way.  If I say anything... that's three.

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: I cannot be responsible for the safety of the prisoners if he is not captured.  This government now considers the existence of POWs an embarrassment.  An unmarked grave in the jungle may be their solution.  I am only an advisor.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Advise my dick, you Siberian scumbag.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Ke-rist.  Whattaya trying to do, man, tickle me?

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Keep driving.

Speaker: vinh
Dialogue: You see?  Not a demon.  A man.  Now, we find where he's crawled to die.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: This your first day?

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: You think you can provoke us into beating you unconscious?  We are not that... unskilled.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: I've had it with you, ratface. Don't piss me off!

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Come on... I love it!  You hear me... I LOVE IT!

Speaker: tech
Dialogue: More AWACS intercepts.  The Russian takes time to translate.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: He's giving them a run for their money.  Says here they've got two Hueys from Danang.  I didn't know those dinks had Hueys.

Speaker: tech
Dialogue: Half their air force is our stuff. Captured.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Typical...

Speaker: tech
Dialogue: Sir, there's something else... a TRANSAT relay.  Just came through.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: You not so hard to catch, dinky dau Rambo.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Christ.  How'd you get here?

Speaker: co
Dialogue: Took bus, most of way.  I knew you would come here.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: And how'd you sneak up like that?

Speaker: co
Dialogue: Carefully.  Don't want to get shot by you.  Bad karma.  Anyway, you need me.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: I do?

Speaker: co
Dialogue: You think you are... .

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Invulnerable.

Speaker: co
Dialogue: In-vul-nerabo.  But you get ass kicked without me.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Yeah.  We're a pretty good team.

Speaker: co
Dialogue: You look like hell.  Wounds infected.  Come up to the ruins, I have medical kit.

Speaker: co
Dialogue: You try get across Laos?  Get to Thailand?

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Yeah.  Got some business there. What are you gonna do?

Speaker: co
Dialogue: Go United States.  See Nguyen. Maybe teach economics.  Buy Cadillac.  Watch "Dynasty."

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: How you going to get there?  You can't trust the spooks to pull you out.  They'll use you up and throw you away.

Speaker: co
Dialogue: I know.  I go with you.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: I couldn't get you in.

Speaker: co
Dialogue: Yes you can.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: co
Dialogue: As wife.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Okay.  Done.  You got it.

Speaker: co
Dialogue: You too easy.

Speaker: co
Dialogue: You don't feel love, Rambo?

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Look, Co...

Speaker: co
Dialogue: Why you don't feel love?  Not allowed?  Dead inside, maybe?  You make yourself dead already so they can't kill you?  In-vulnerabo?  Bullshit!

Speaker: co
Dialogue: I have enough death already. Husband.  Mother.  Father. Brothers.  Death everywhere.

Speaker: co
Dialogue: You see?  A flower like that need good soil to grow.  Many time under earth is bones of animal... or person.  Killed in jungle.  Make soil rich.  Grows most beautiful flower.  You call orchid.  Many deaths in jungle.  Vietnamese, V.C., American.  Many beautiful flowers.

Speaker: palyushin
Dialogue: Get your men back.  I'm beginning an attack run.

Speaker: co
Dialogue: What was that?

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Minigun.  Come on.  Let's move. He's coming in on our open side.

Speaker: palyushin
Dialogue: Return to staging area.  We have to reload.

Speaker: co
Dialogue: Dinky-dau-Rambo.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: John.  My name is John.

Speaker: co
Dialogue: It doesn't hurt.  Why doesn't it hurt?

Speaker: palyushin
Dialogue: Air Three, are you in position?

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: Ready, Air Command.

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: How many are down there?

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: One.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: ... you're gonna love it there. It'll be great.  We can do what we want... you and me... go to the beach... with Nguyen... watch him ridin' his surfboard...

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Oh, God...

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: 500 meters.  Final approach.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: 'Palm.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Well, have they got him yet?

Speaker: tech
Dialogue: Um... actually, no.  It looks like he shot down one of their gunships...

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: Christ almighty.

Speaker: tech
Dialogue: ... and then he, uh... took the other one.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: tech
Dialogue: He... took it.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Gawd, you look awful.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: You comin'?

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Hold your pantyhose.  Here, gimme a hand.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Can you handle the door gun?

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Duck soup.

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: Am I dreaming this?  This is not real, right?  I oughta grease you pricks, but I've known you too long.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Let's go, De Fravio.  Move it!

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: We got company.  You better pull some pitch, buddy.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Brewer!  You know what that thing's packing?

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: It's a Soviet MIL MI-24.  Probably has 12.7mm nose cannon, heat-seeking rockets and wire guided missiles, plus...

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Forget it.

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: I think I'm gonna be sick.

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: They're approaching the border. Should we notify the Laotian Air Force?

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: No.  We'll take them ourselves.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Hell.  This is just like fucking Star Wars, man!

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: Star Wars?

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: You're gonna love it.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: How much we got left in that minigun?

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Pretty low.  Couple of seconds worth.

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: We're in Laos, Sir.

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: I know that!  Fire all your rockets.  Take him down!

Speaker: podovsk
Dialogue: We've got him.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: The thrill of victory, the agony of defeat!

Speaker: lifer
Dialogue: Hey, Colonel.  You're not cleared to be on this base anymore.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: ... and there's this guy with a black helmet and cape, right, and he's got this sword... except it's not a sword, it's light...

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: There's the Mekong.

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: When the unidentified helicopter has crossed the river into Thailand, shoot it down with air-to-air rockets.  Then proceed to the crash site and fire your remaining rockets into the wreckage.  Is this understood, Zen Hammer?

Speaker: kirkhill
Dialogue: What are you talking about?  Why?

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: Escort them on in.

Speaker: trautman
Dialogue: All base personnel.  Prepare medical facilities to receive American POWs.

Speaker: rambo
Dialogue: Mission accomplished.

Speaker: brewer
Dialogue: Cover of Time Magazine, baby!

Speaker: de fravio
Dialogue: You did good, buddy.  Real good!
